intro: Boehmeria grandis var. kauaiensis, commonly known as Kauai hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the forest. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
